name: a golden empire
title: A Golden Empire
description: Enact a Golden Age as an Empire.
requirements: Is in a golden era
Is an empire
notes: The golden era can be started on the first day of the next month after completing 3 objectives. Easily done as  Ming. You begin as an empire, already have a 30-development capital, and have more than five centres of trade at the beginning, you just need to release five vassals and you can begin your golden era.

name: aaa credit
title: AAA Credit
description: As a Great Power, take on over 1,000 ducats of another nation's debt.
requirements: Is a Great power
Has taken on 1000 ducats of another country's debt.
notes: Must be done in a single action.

name: all that's thine shall be mine
title: All That's Thine Shall Be Mine
description: As a Greedy ruler, take all of a nation's ducats in a peace deal.
requirements: Took all of an enemy nation's ducats in a peace deal, during the reign of a  Greedy Ruler.
notes: Can be achieved without being the warleader by having a Greedy ruler and the warleader taking all of a nation's  ducats in a peace deal. The Rulers of  Amago,  Cleves,  Cologne,  Hatakeyama,  Isshiki,  Khandesh,  Lüneburg and  Otomo are greedy at the start of the game.

name: cold war
title: Cold War
description: Win a war without fighting a single battle.
requirements: Won one war without fighting a single battle.
notes: Start as a neighbor of an OPM. Go to a total war with them and sign peace (break their alliances if needed and take all their money). Soon after declare another war (breaking the truce) and capture their undefended capital.

name: combined arms
title: Combined Arms
description: Have both an Admiral and a General with a trait.
starting_conditions: No restriction of the start date
requirements: Have an Admiral with a trait
Have a General with a trait
notes:
Conquistadors and explorers do not count.
Leaders gain traits at the end of battles with a chance based on the military tradition gain from that battle, which is based (in part) on the number of losses inflicted on the enemy. The  Ottomans and  France start with a general with a trait in 1444.

name: cowardly tactics
title: Cowardly Tactics
description: Have a fort and a supply depot in a mountainous province producing livestock.
requirements: Own and control a livestock-producing mountain province with a fort building and a supply depot
notes: Possible to achieve in Custom Setup and Random Setup nation modes. Very easy to do with  Mamluks, who start with a fort on a livestock province. Easily done as  Three Leagues, who has a livestock producing mountain province with a fort at the start.

name: czechs and balances
title: Czechs and Balances
description: Starting as Bohemia, grant at least two privileges to each estate while having at least 50% Crown Land.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: at least two privileges are currently granted to the  clergy
at least two privileges are currently granted to the  burghers
at least two privileges are currently granted to the  nobility
Land owned by the crown is at least 50%
notes:
This can be done easily by starting as Bohemia and then releasing Moravia as a vassal and selecting the option to play as the released vassal. Afterwards, you'll have more than 80% Crown Land and now you can give 2 privileges to each estate. Several of the privileges do not affect the size of the Crown Land which makes it easy to stay above 50%.
This achievement can be combined with the Great Moravia achievement.

name: defender of the faith
title: Defender of the Faith
description: Become Defender of the Faith.
starting_conditions: Is not defender of the faith
requirements: Is defender of the faith
notes: Can be done immediately as  Ottomans, just take out a few loans and claim the title.

name: for the glory
title: For the Glory
description: Diplo-annex a vassal.
requirements: Have diplomatically annexed a vassal.
notes: Start as  Ayutthaya, then annex either of their vassals after 10 years. Also easy with  Denmark which can annex its vassal  Holstein.

name: foul mouthed
title: Foul Mouthed
description: Scornfully insult 10 nations that border you.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points
requirements: At least 10 neighbouring countries have the “Scornfully Insulted” opinion modifier towards you
notes: The 10 countries must all have the opinion modifier at the same time.  Lithuania borders 11 nations at the start of game. You can ally  Poland to complete "The Polish Succession" mission which gives claims on  Livonian Order. Declare war as soon as the truce expires and demand they concede defeat and end rivalries in the peace deal. This should easily get you the required 50 prestige.

name: full house
title: Full House
description: Have 3 Vassals and 2 Marches at the same time.
requirements: Have 3 vassals
Have 2 marches
notes: Easily done as  England,  Muscovy,  Lithuania or  Timurids at the start of the campaign.

name: gentle persuasion
title: Gentle Persuasion
description: Have a Siege Specialist general win a siege in a province with a fort.
starting_conditions: No restriction of the start date
requirements: Won a siege against a fort using a General with the Siege Specialist trait.
notes: Easily done as  France as they begin with a siege specialist general.

name: isn't this the way to india?
title: Isn't this the way to India?
description: Discover the Americas as Castile or Spain.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World.
Has not discovered both North America and South America
requirements: Has discovered North America and South America
notes: Remove the terra incognita of 1 province in the continent of South America and 1 province in the continent of North America.

name: it's all about the money
title: It's all about the money
description: Accumulate 3000 gold.
requirements: Have 3,000 ducats in the treasury
notes: Easily done as a big nation by taking loans until reaching the target.

name: liberty or death
title: Liberty or Death
description: Start as United States in 1776 bookmark and own all your cores while being at peace.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World.
requirements: Not at war
Own all core provinces
notes: Can be done easily by signing a peace treaty and accepting any demands. Then revoke all the cores of the provinces given away. The last step requires the Art of War DLC.

name: krabater
title: Krabater
description: Form the nation of Croatia and station a unit of cavalry in Stockholm.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Is  Croatia
Station a unit of cavalry in Stockholm.
notes: Since the 1.30 Austria update, Croatia exists from the start in 1444. All you have to do to get this achievement is to ask for military access with all the essential nations on the way to Stockholm. Don't bother your diplomatic relation slots. Then move your one cavalry unit there. Done in 2 min.

name: marshy march
title: Marshy March
description: Have a march with at least two marsh provinces.
requirements: Have a march with at least two marsh provinces
notes: Easily done as  Mushasha, simply release  Basra.

name: my true friend
title: My True Friend
description: Go to war in support of a rebel faction and win, enforcing their demands.
requirements: Help a rebel faction win a war against another country

name: narcissism
title: Narcissism
description: Name a general after yourself and lead your army to victory.
requirements: Either
An army is led by a general with the player's Steam name
Win a battle with a general with the player's Steam name
or

Has a leader named after one of the following VIPs - “DDRJake”, “Duplo”, “neondt”, “StarNaN”, “The French Paradox”, “Bus”, “Groogy”, “mikesc”, “PDJR_Alastorn”, “Ofaloaf”, “Caligula Caesar”, “Imse”, “KaiserJohan” or “Hawky”.
notes: Possible to achieve in Custom Setup and Random Setup nation modes. Can be done without Cradle of Civilization by editing the player's Steam name to match the name of a general or by creating monarch in Custom Setup with exact name as player's Steam name and assign as general.

name: not so sad a state...
title: Not so sad a state...
description: As Portugal, have a colony in Brazil and in Africa.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Have a colony in both Brazil and in the continent of Africa
notes: Establish two colonies in Brazil and in Africa. Keep in mind the colonies need to be established, not finished, so this can be done extremely quickly after unlocking the first two exploration ideas. The name is a reference to a since deleted thread announcing the cancellation of the EU3 spin-off game "Magna Mundi", which was being developed by a Portuguese company.

name: populists in government
title: Populists in Government
description: Switch government type through government reforms.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points
requirements: Has switched government type via a government reform
notes: Fastest as a tribal nation, as only 5 reforms are needed to change government type.

name: pyramid of skulls
title: Pyramid of Skulls
description: As a Steppe Horde, raze a province with at least 30 development.
requirements: Is steppe nomad
Razed a province of at least 30 development.
notes: The eligible provinces in 1444 are Milan (30), Nanjing (33), Beijing (33) and Constantinople after Ottoman conquest (34), although it is much easier to conquer a good province from a minor, develop it to 30, give it back, conquer again and finally raze it.

name: queen of conquest
title: Queen of Conquest
description: Conquer land while in a Queen Regency.
requirements: Have a consort regency with a female consort
Conquered land
notes: The achievement won't be given if the player full-annexes a country due to a bug.[1]

name: seriously?!
title: Seriously?!
description: Kill 10,000 men in one battle.
requirements: Have killed 10 000 men in one battle.

name: subsidize my love
title: Subsidize my Love
description: Subsidize 3 different allies at least 50% of their monthly income without running a deficit.
requirements: Does not have negative monthly income
Have 3 allies that are subsidized at least 50%.
notes: Easily done as  England with the Irish minors or as  Austria with HRE OPMs.

name: tear down this wall
title: Tear Down This Wall
description: Use artillery Barrage on Berlin.
requirements: Has used artillery barrage on Berlin.

name: that is mine!
title: That is mine!
description: Conquer a province.
requirements: Have conquered one new province.

name: that's a grand army
title: That's a Grand Army
description: Build up your army to your country's maximum army forcelimit.
starting_conditions: Army size isn't 99% of maximum force limit
requirements: Have an army size that is 99% of maximum force limit
notes: This achievement is not awarded if the player plays a nation that already is at or is over its maximum force limit.

name: that's a grand navy
title: That's a Grand Navy
description: Build up your navy to your country's maximum navy forcelimit.
starting_conditions: Navy size isn't 99% of maximum force limit
requirements: Have a navy size that is 99% of maximum force limit

name: the continuation of diplomacy
title: The Continuation of Diplomacy
description: Successfully use Threaten War to gain a province from another nation.
requirements: Have acquired a province through threatening war.
notes: Easily done as  Ming after fabricating a claim on either  Kham or  Korchin.

name: this is my faith
title: This is My Faith
description: Convert to Protestantism and unlock 3 Aspects of Faith.
requirements: Is Protestant
Have 3 aspects of faith
notes: Bohemia, the nations in the British Isles and those in Scandinavia start in a great position for this achievement.

name: three trivial tributary tribes
title: Three Trivial Tributary Tribes
description: Have 3 Tribal States as Tributaries.
starting_conditions: Religious group is Eastern or government type is  Steppe Nomads.
requirements: Has 3 Tributary States with government type Steppe Nomads, Tribal Despotism, Tribal Monarchy, Tribal Federation, Tribal Democracy, Native Council, or Siberian Clan Council.
notes: Easily done as  Ming at the start of the campaign.

name: time bandit
title: Time Bandit
description: Successfully steal a map from another nation.
requirements: Stole a map from another country.

name: truly divine ruler
title: Truly Divine Ruler
description: Get a 5/5/5 Ruler.
starting_conditions: Starting ruler has less than 5 skill in any category
requirements: Have a ruler that has at least 5 skill in every category
notes: Easiest way to obtain this achievement is starting with  Poland and appoint a local noble ruler for the event. In contrary to the achievement text getting a better ruler than 5/5/5 also counts.

name: until death do us apart
title: Until death do us apart
description: Secure a Royal Marriage with another country.
starting_conditions: Is not in a royal marriage
requirements: Have a royal marriage
notes: Note that it won't trigger if the player already has one or more royal marriages at game start.

name: victorious!
title: Victorious!
description: Win a war.
requirements: Has won a war.
notes: Win a war as the main participant.

name: viva la revolución!
title: Viva la Revolución!
description: Have rebels you support in another country enforce their demands.
requirements: Have supported rebels in another country that enforced their demands.

name: a pile of gold
title: A Pile of Gold
description: Own 10 provinces which produce gold.
requirements: Own 10 Gold provinces
notes:
In 1444, the Niger region has 3, the South Africa and East Africa regions have 5, the Peru and Upper Peru regions have 6, and the Mexico region has 5. Does not require provinces to be cored. Provinces owned by colonial nations do not count (playing as released colonial nation counts to achieve pile of gold).

 All pre-determined gold provinces

name: a protected market
title: A Protected Market
description: Have 100% Mercantilism.
requirements: Have 100% mercantilism
notes:
Only easy with  DLC. Can be easily attained by playing an isolated country such as  Ternate or  Tidore, eliminating nearby threats, and then ignoring technology and just pressing the "promote mercantilism" button until you get the achievement.
Without Mare Nostrum, it is easiest to do as  England, who start with 25% mercantilism and have a unique decision which gives a 10% boost.

name: absolutely
title: Absolutely
description: Gain 100 Absolutism.
requirements: Have 100 absolutism
notes:
Possible to achieve in Custom Setup and Random Setup nation modes.
 Sweden and  Prussia have events to increase their maximum absolutism.  France,  Portugal,  Sweden, and  Russia have events, decisions, or ideas that give yearly absolutism gain.

name: abu bakr ii’s ambition
title: Abu Bakr II’s Ambition
description: Start as Mali and have 4 Colonial Subjects in South America.
requirements: Have 4 colonial nations based in the continent of South America
notes: All 4 colonies must have their capital on the South American continent. Possible with Colombia when not colonizing Panama or further north. Might be possible with Caribbeans based of Trinidad.

name: aggressive expander
title: Aggressive Expander
description: Own 200 provinces.
requirements: Own 200 provinces.
notes: Easiest to do as  Ming.

name: all belongs to mother russia
title: All belongs to Mother Russia
description: Start as a country of Russian culture and form Russia.
starting_conditions: Primary culture is either Muscovite, Ryazanian or Novgorodian
requirements: Is  Russia
notes: Easiest to do as  Muscovy.

name: an industrial evolution
title: An Industrial Evolution
description: As Great Britain, own all of England as core provinces and have at least 25 development in each province there.
requirements: Not as a released vassal.
Is  Great Britain
Own and have cores on the London, East Midlands, West Midlands, East Anglia, Wessex, and Yorkshire areas with each province having at least 25 development. (The Northern England area is not needed)

name: at every continent
title: At every continent
description: Own one province on each continent.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World.
requirements: Own a province in each of the 6 continents.
notes:
The continents are: Europe, Asia, Africa, North America, South America, and Oceania. Most easily done as  Spain or  Portugal, as they can colonize faster.
NOTE Colonial Nations do not count, you must own the provinces directly.

name: azur semé de lis or
title: Azur semé de lis or
description: Get all the French Cores as France.
requirements: All cored provinces are owned by  France
notes: Aside from reconquest, can also be done by revoking the cores from non-owned provinces.

name: baa baa black sheep
title: Baa Baa Black Sheep
description: As Qara Qoyunlu become the leading producer of wool.
requirements: Be production leader of wool
notes:
You start with 5 wool-producing provinces. Focus solely on accumulating diplomatic points to develop them. Can be done before 1450.
Alternatively, annexing  Bitlis with 3 additional provinces will reduce the amount of developing needed (note that annexation can start as early as 1445 in this case). Annexing neighbouring OPM  Hisn Kayfa also helps, as they produce wool.

name: black jack
title: Black Jack
description: Have at least 21 different subjects with 5 cities each and without any subject having 50% or more Liberty Desire. Trade Companies do not count.
requirements: Has 21 different subjects with more than 5 cities and less than 50%  liberty desire
notes:
Can be easily achieved with Tributary states as the Chinese Emperor with the Mandate of Heaven DLC or  Ashikaga with its daimyos.
Can also be achieved by conquering swathes of low-development land and releasing client states.

name: blockader
title: Blockader
description: Blockade at least 10 ports of one enemy.
requirements: Blockade at least 10 enemy ports at the same time.
notes: Easily done as the  Ottomans with the  Mamluks at the start of the campaign.

name: blood for the sky god!
title: Blood for the Sky God!
description: As a Tengri nation, have Nahuatl as your syncretic faith.
requirements: Is Tengri
Syncretic faith is  Nahuatl
notes: Start as a Jurchen tribe and choose  Exploration ideas first. Conquer Eastern Siberia for colonial range to North America and colony-hop to Mesoamerica. Do not form  Qing.

name: bright spark
title: Bright Spark
description: Have 50 Innovativeness.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points if playing as a custom nation
requirements: Have 50 Innovativeness
notes: Starting as Florence, only focus on technology and doctrines, accept all events that give innovativeness and always choose the same leader during election, can be done before 1550.

name: brothers in arms
title: Brothers in Arms
description: Win a war as a secondary participant.
requirements: Won a war without being the war leader.

name: center of attention
title: Center of Attention
description: Own both a Protestant and a Reformed Center of Reformation.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Own a Protestant center of reformation
Own a Reformed center of reformation
notes: A random event creates the first Center of Reformation for each denomination. After that, the next two nations in Europe to convert have a random province designated as a Center of Reformation. Alternatively be on the first two to convert to Protestantism, and when you have a new monarch and Reformed has spawned, convert to Reformed.

name: chop chop
title: Chop Chop
description: With only one Monarch, have six different Consorts.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points if playing as a custom nation
requirements: Have six different consorts
notes: As an Anglican nation, (a)Divorce Consort every 100 church power, then wait for a new consort; (b)royal marriage with another nation or (c) press "Marry a local Noblewoman" button in religious panel. Cycle through the options five times. Kill the heir if necessary. Easily doable if the ruler is young.

name: cities of cibola
title: Cities of Cibola
description: As Pueblo, own at least seven provinces with 10 development each.
requirements: Own 7 provinces with at least 10 development each
notes: Easily achieved by declaring no-CB wars on adjacent starting nations and manually developing provinces. You can get three development in your capital with the Expand Nation mission  after increasing the development of your country by 50.

name: city of cities
title: City of Cities
description: Own a core province with at least 60 development.
requirements: Own and have core a city with at least 60 development
notes: Easiest to do as the  Ottomans with Constantinople.

name: colonial management
title: Colonial Management
description: Have 3 colonial governors that were directly appointed by you at the same time.
requirements: Appoint 3 colonial governors holding office in your colonies at the same time
notes: "Appoint Colonial Governor" is a subject action you may perform on your colonial subjects.

name: david the builder
title: David the Builder
description: As Imereti, form Georgia and have no free building slots.
requirements: Is  Georgia
No owned provinces have a free building slot
notes: Can be done by filling the capital with buildings and then giving all other provinces to vassals.

name: die please die
title: Die Please Die
description: Have a ruler with 1 or lower in all three categories who is over the age of 70.
requirements: Is not in a regency
Have a ruler that:
Has less than 2 in every Monarch power
Has reached the age of 70 years
notes: Mali's ruler is eligible.  Castile's starting heir is eligible. Very easy in 1.22 or earlier with  Timurids' 67 year old ruler.  Karaman starts out with 1/0/0 leader and 0/0/1 heir that can also work.

name: disciples of enlightenment
title: Disciples of Enlightenment
description: Starting as Dai Viet, have 10 nations follow the Mahayana Faith by 1500.
requirements: The year is before 1500
at least 10 nations follow the Mahayana faith
notes:
Note that the player's country itself does count.
 Pangasinan already starts as Mahayana, effectively bringing down the requirement to 9, and the Philippine islands are an excellent place to start forcing conversions.

name: double the love
title: Double the Love
description: Start with no unions and get two at the same time.
requirements: Have 2 or more personal unions
notes: Obtainable as Castile if the union with Aragon occurs whilst they maintain their union with Naples, or as Muscovy by claiming  Tver and  Ryazan thrones. It does not mean inheriting two personal unions simultaneously, only that a country starting with no personal unions eventually holds two at the same time. These unions can occur independently.  Poland is good option as well, because it can easily get union with  Bohemia and  Lithuania.

name: down under
title: Down Under
description: Have a colony in Australia.
requirements: Have a colony in Australia.
notes: Easily done as one of the nations located in proximity to the region. Establish a colony on any province of the Australian coastline (no need to finish the colony). Taking someone's colony in Australia when signing peace won't earn the achievement.

name: dude, where's my boat?
title: Dude, Where's my Boat?
description: Capture 20 boats with the Boarding Naval Doctrine.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points if playing as a custom nation
requirements: Capture 20 boats
Have the Boarding naval doctrine

name: early-modern warfare
title: Early-Modern Warfare
description: Have 100 regiments at 100% Army Drill.
requirements: Have 100 regiments at 100% Army Drill
notes: Possible to achieve in Custom Setup and Random Setup nation modes. Easy as  Ming; just go slightly over force limit and drill for ten years.

name: electable!
title: Electable!
description: Become an elector in the HRE as a country which does not start as elector.
starting_conditions: Does not start as an elector of the Holy Roman Empire
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Become an elector of the Holy Roman Empire
notes: Easily done by annexing an elector (e.g.  Mainz) while having good relations with the Emperor. Other possibility is to inherit an elector, e.g. as Austria if you inherit Bohemia (not integrate) the electorate will pass to you.

name: forgive me, for i have sindh
title: Forgive me, for I have Sindh
description: Become Christian as Sindh.
requirements: Is  Sindh
Religion is in Christian group
notes: Socotra is the nearest Christian province and can be easily conquered. Provoke the rebel zealots and let them enforce their demands.

name: four for trade
title: Four For Trade
description: Form four Trade Companies and get bonus merchants from all of them.
requirements: Control 4 strong trade companies
notes: A trade company must control at least 51% of the trade power in its node for it to be a "strong" company and give you an extra merchant. Far easier since 1.30, as trade companies can now be made in all regions not your own, including European regions.

name: god tier
title: God Tier
description: Become a Tier 5 Defender of the Faith as a nation that is neither Catholic nor Sunni.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: religion is not  catholic
religion is not  sunni
is defender of the faith of tier 5

name: grand coalition
title: Grand Coalition
description: Join a coalition of more than 5 nations.
requirements: Be a part of a coalition with 6 or more members
notes: Way easier with the more aggressive AI from 1.20 onwards.

name: grand duchy
title: Grand Duchy
description: Starting as a Duchy, have 1000 development without upgrading your government rank.
requirements: Government rank is  Duchy
Has at least 1000 development
notes: Muscovy is the largest duchy in 1444, though  Lithuania could also work well. The most important thing is to remember not to upgrade or form a nation (like  Russia or  Commonwealth) that gives a higher government rank as you'll become ineligible for the achievement.

name: hard bargaining
title: Hard Bargaining
description: As Defender of a Muslim Faith, propagate your religion in The Moluccas through trade to convert 5 provinces.
requirements: Is in the Muslim religious group
Is Defender of the Faith
Propagated Religion in 5 provinces in the Moluccas trade node.
notes:
Possible to achieve in Custom Setup or Random Setup nation modes.
You are required to be Defender of the Faith when the provinces are converted.

name: holiest roman empire
title: Holiest Roman Empire
description: As either the Papal States or the Emperor, have the Papal States as an Elector while the HRE is officially Catholic.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Is  The Papal State or is the emperor of the Holy Roman Empire
catholic is the dominant faith of the Holy Roman Empire
the Holy Roman Empire has an official, unchangeable faith
The Papal State is an elector
notes: You can start as  Austria, and full annex  The Papal State. When  The Papal State is given a province in the empire, you can grant them elector status.

name: imperio español
title: Imperio español
description: As Spain have Mexico, Panama, Havana, Cuzco in colonial Nations under you.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Is  Spain
Have colonial nations in Mexico, Panama, Havana, and Cuzco.

name: in the name of the father
title: In the Name of the Father
description: As an Orthodox country, have 100 Patriarch Authority.
requirements: Have Patriarch Authority of 100%

name: it's all about luck
title: It's all about luck
description: Win a battle against a great leader, without a leader.
requirements: Defeated an enemy leader with 3 stars.
notes: Easily done as the  Ottomans attacking  Albania at the start of the campaign.

name: just a little patience
title: Just a Little Patience
description: Play a campaign from 1444 until 1820.
requirements: Is year 1820

name: just resting in my account
title: Just Resting In My Account
description: Corrupt the officials in a rival country
requirements: Corrupted officials in a rival country.

name: kow-tow
title: Kow-Tow
description: As Ming, have a subject from each religion group.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Have a subject nation in each of the 5 religious groups (Christian, Muslim, Eastern, Dharmic, Pagan)
notes: No CB War against Mikhlaf in Arabia, vassalise them in the peace deal. Ally a neighbour (Yemen is a good choice), ask for maps of the horn of Africa and then establish one of the Coptic minors as a tributary. Done by 1447.

name: land of eastern jade
title: Land of Eastern Jade
description: Own a core province in Central America as a Buddhist country.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World.
requirements: Be  Theravada,  Vajrayana, or  Mahayana.
Own a core province in Mexico.

name: made in japan
title: Made in Japan
description: Embrace "manufactories" institution as Japan by 1655.
requirements: The year is before 1655
Is  Japan
Has embraced the  Manufactories institution

name: magellan’s voyage
title: Magellan’s Voyage
description: Make the first circumnavigation.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Is the first to circumnavigate the World.
notes: Colonize along the route as much as possible, or get fleet basing rights. Fully-repaired ships can be stationed along the way to join the explorer's fleet before he moves to the next sea tile. If the fleet stops to repair, ships can also be sent to augment it while it is in port. How long the AI takes to circumnavigate varies from game to game.

name: maharana pratap
title: Maharana Pratap
description: Start as Mewar and field an army of 20 Rajput regiments.
requirements: Has at least 20 Rajput regiments

name: multiculturalism
title: Multiculturalism
description: Have 4 different Cultures and 4 different religions represented in your court.
starting_conditions: No more than 1 custom nation exists in the world
Used no more than 201 nation designer points if playing as a custom nation
requirements: Four different religions in court
Four different cultures in court
notes: Possible to achieve in Custom Setup nation mode. Spawned advisors take the culture and religion of a random held province. Easy as  Ming: dismiss advisors until you have one Theravada, one Animist, and one Vajrayana advisor. Release nations to increase the proportion of your provinces which have one of the remaining religions.

name: networking
title: Networking
description: Have 100 point spy networks in 3 rival nations.
requirements: Have 100 point spy networks in 3 rival nations

name: nobody wants to die
title: Nobody wants to die
description: Own Timbuktu as Songhai
requirements: Own and core the province of Timbuktu

description: In a war against the target of the Revolution, control their capital and have at least 99% war score.
requirements: Is at war with a revolution target
Control the capital of the revolution target
Have greater than 98% warscore against the revolution target
notes: The Revolution disaster (and the French Revolution variant) is announced in a major event: 'Revolution in $COUNTRY$' (or 'The General Estates'). A country will become the revolution target, with "Revolutionary" in its name, if its capital is occupied by rebels while this disaster is active. The disaster spawns a stack of rebels, adds +10 national unrest, removes 3 stability, and can only be ended by having +3 stability while being a monarchy, or by becoming the revolution target. It is feasible both to wait for (or encourage) an AI revolution target, or to become the revolutionary target oneself before releasing (and playing as) a powerful vassal or colonial nation. The player can check if the disaster is still active for a country by looking for the +10 unrest modifier on its provinces.

But it is also possible to form  Mexico or  Texas by moving your capital to the previously mentioned (colonial) region before a colonial nation forms. Then no DLC is necessary.

name: stern des südens
title: Stern des Südens
description: Form Bavaria starting as München and have your Subject Bremen own Werder.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Is  Bavaria
Bremen is a subject of  Bavaria
Bremen owns Werder (2778)
File:Stern des Südens map.png
notes: Werder (2778) is in the Horn of Africa region and owned by  Marehan at the start of the game. As Munich, take your time consolidating into Bavaria. If you can, befriend the emperor and/or electors to make your life within the HRE easier. Once you have a border with Bremen or a coastal provinces in coring range of Bremen, keep an eye out for opportunities to start a war that Bremen will be involved in. As Bremen is a free city, it will be much harder if you declare directly on them directly (as the Emperor will defend free cities). Annex Bremen in a separate peace and release them as your vassal(you can't vassalize a free city in a peace deal). Afterwards consolidate power and grow large enough to combat your most powerful neighbours - Ottomans, Spain, France, etc. Make sure to give Bremen land as well, either in the direction of the Ottomans or in the direction of Spain. You will have to fight your way through one and feed Bremen provinces to "snake" Bremen's land down to Werder (This is because vassals need adjacent land or sea tiles to be given provinces and do not care about coring distance/colonial range). The least time-consuming method would be to give them a province per sea tile starting from the Mediterranean, down through the Mamelukes to the red sea coast, and finally down to Werder.

notes: Quickly vassalize Byzantium, feed them back their cores, ally Austria/Hungary to combat the Ottomans early game. Conquer all the centers of trade/estuaries in the Constantinople trade node feed them to Byzantium. You can release Bulgaria and feed them as well so Byzantium does not have as high development. Repeat this by releasing Syria and feeding them back their cores and conquering/feeding Syria centers of trade in Alexandria node. Keep vassals happy by developing their provinces, placating and developing your own provinces to make yourself seem stronger. Plurocratic/Influence/Diplomatic/Innovative ideas help with keeping vassals loyal because of ideas, policies and dip rep. Take Trade Idea group. You can drop Crete, Corfu and Dalmacija and pick up Milan and Ragusa, Release Croatia to help control the Ragusa trade node to ensure your wealth.

Pirate's republics can declare war on Colonial nations without their overlord being called as an ally, so if Europeans begin to colonize the Caribbean before you can finish, it may be easier to allow a colonial nation to form.

name: academical
title: Academical
description: As Athens, own 50 universities.
requirements: Not playing as a released vassal
Is  Athens
50 owned provinces have  Universities.
notes: Start by getting support independence from the  Ottomans and declare independence against Byzantium. Give land to the Ottoman in the peace deal if you want but get independence. Wait until tech 11. During this time, get exploration and expansion ideas as well as upgrading Athens so it is generating a profit of ducats as well as being able to afford level 1 advisors for admin and dip. Exiting and rejoining the game may result in the Ottoman deciding to give you subsidies as well. When you reach tech 11 you should have about 500 ducats and the 50% range bonus from exploration. You should try to reroll your dip advisor for the 20% colonizing range. From here you should save 220 dip so you can expel minority for your first colony in the Caribbean. It is recommended to only do 1 or 2 colonies until you can financially support all 3. After your first colony, try to prioritize colonizing the centers of trade and continue colonizing the Caribbean. You will want to make the Caribbean your center of trade. After all of the 8+ dev land is colonized start colonizing the US east coast. From here you are pretty much guaranteed to get the achievement, however if you wish to speed it up you can take Mexico / Peru to help speed up the process. Eventually, make the Chesapeake Bay your center for trade and transfer trade from other nodes to it.

name: empire of mann
title: Empire of Mann
description: As Mann, conquer all Islands in the world.
requirements: Is  Mann
Own or have non-tributary subjects own all provinces which are on an island.
notes:
Mann can't be selected as a country in 1444, you must release it as a vassal and choose the option to play as released vassal.
As England release Mann at the very start of the game. After 10 years you can annex them again. As the annexation progresses grant them your provinces bit by bit before the process hits 100%. You can even move your capital to continental Europe and give London to Mann. Be careful about France as they will likely attack you once you are weakened. After annexation is finished spend all your monarch points to boost provinces that Mann considers as core. Now release Mann again and chose to play as released vassal. Do not form England again or any other country because it will prevent getting the achievement.
Alternatively, sabotage England as much as possible, such as releasing all releasable nations, leaving Mann for last. Release and play as them, then ally all other released nations, plus a major like Castile. Take London, Sussex, and Kent in first war and you should be off to a great start.

name: rags and riches
title: Rags and Riches
description: Have the highest income in the world while neither owning nor starting with a province with a development level higher than 10.
starting_conditions: No owned province has more than  10 development at the start of the game
requirements: No owned province has more than  10 development
No other country has a higher income than this country
notes:
This can be done easiest as Norway in the current patch of 1.29.5. Stay as a vassal under Denmark for protection, rush expansion ideas, then get exploration after you reach diplomatic tech 7, and colonize Newfoundland from there, triggering the grand banks fishery which will power your colonial nation of Vinland. After Vinland forms, you can release and choose to play as them well within the time-frame of Denmark beginning integration, bypassing the PU. From there, expand and build as many manufactories as possible, swapping into canada or Quebec's ideas, or even the USA. An important thing to note is that you can have a 10+ development province after the start of the campaign, but NOT during the month you're trying to count highest income.
Great alternative start is Pomerania. Play regular HRE game, expanding into denmark and russia. Exploit all provinces within 10-20 development, boost development of all provinces below 10. Eventually your income from flat 10dev provinces will be the highest in the world, especially if you consider expanding into west and taking control over the Channel. Keep all high dev provinces like Lubeck under vassals.

starting_conditions: Playing as one of the following:
requirements: Is  Mughals
The year is before 1550
Every province in India superregion is owned by the country or a subject other than a tributary

name: factionalism
title: Factionalism
description: Have 3 different estates in your country with at least 70% influence each.
requirements: Have 3 estates with 70% influence
notes: Easily done as  France by giving all provinces to estates at start and pushing all the interaction buttons.

name: inner turmoil
title: Inner Turmoil
description: Starting as The Isles, own 20 provinces by 1500, none of which are on Islands.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: The year is before 1500
owns at least 20 provinces that are not on an island
notes: it is allowed to have provinces on islands, but these don't count towards the 20. Islands in the context of this achievement means any province which does not have a land connection to mainland continents, meaning any province in Britain or Ireland will not count. Unfinished colonies also don't count. An easy way to achieve this is to wait until one of the berber nations is without allies and noCB them. You can core Moroccan and Sus provinces with extended range from exploration ideas and the colonial range advisor. From there, you can keep eating North Africa, or go to West Africa. The provinces do not need to be cored.

name: mary of lotharingia
title: Mary of Lotharingia
description: Starting as Burgundy, form Lotharingia and have a female ruler named Marie.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Is  Lotharingia
ruler is female
ruler's name is Marie

name: napoleon’s ambition
title: Napoleon’s Ambition
description: As Revolutionary France, spread the Revolution to 10 countries.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Is  France
has used the “Spread the Revolution” peace term 10 times

name: on the rhodes again
title: On the Rhodes Again
description: Starting as The Knights, conquer and core Constantinople, Jerusalem and Antioch.
starting_conditions: Not using a random New World
requirements: Own and core the provinces of Constantinople (151), Antioch (2313) and Jerusalem (379)
notes: Forming  Jerusalem will not prevent you from getting the achievement

name: stiff upper lippe

Own all provinces in Britain
Britain region
notes: Lippe doesn't exist in 1444, but it can be released from its core province Ravensberg (4775) which is owned by  Berg.
